title: Understanding Medication-Assisted Treatment
text: Medication-assisted treatment (MAT) is a comprehensive approach to treating substance use disorders. It combines medication with counseling and behavioral therapies to provide a holistic treatment plan.

title: Components of MAT
text: MAT involves the use of FDA-approved medications, in combination with counseling and behavioral therapies, to treat substance use disorders and prevent opioid overdose.

hintAnswer: combines the use of medication and behavioral therapy to prevent opioid overdose and treat substance use disorder
title: Identify the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes medication-assisted treatment?
choices: focuses on meeting the client where they are and helping to prevent overdose, reducing transmission of infectious diseases, and improving the overall health of the client
combines the use of medication and behavioral therapy to prevent opioid overdose and treat substance use disorder
assisting a client through a period of acute detoxification and withdrawal so that they are medically stable and $$substance-free$$
